titleStmt.title: Publick good without private interest, or, A compendious remonstrance of the present sad state and condition of the English colonie of Virginea [sic] with a modest declaration of the severall causes ... why it hath not prospered better hitherto ... / humbly presented to His Highness the Lord Protectour, by a person zealously devoted, to the more effectual propagating of the Gospel in that nation ...
titleStmt.author: Gatford, Lionel, d. 1665.

titleStmt.title: Publick good without private interest, or, A compendious remonstrance of the present sad state and condition of the English colonie of Virginea [sic] with a modest declaration of the severall causes ... why it hath not prospered better hitherto ... / humbly presented to His Highness the Lord Protectour, by a person zealously devoted, to the more effectual propagating of the Gospel in that nation ...
titleStmt.author: Gatford, Lionel, d. 1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Marsh, and are to be sold at the Crown ...,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: L.G.[i.e. Lionel Gatford--Cf. Wing 2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library.
